person.persName: William Hercules Hays (Colonel of the 10th Kentucky Infantry and Inspector General of Kentucky)

body.p: A Kentucky attorney, solider, and judge. Educated in Washington County, Kentucky schools. Read law in Elizabethtown, Kentucky under James W. Hays and attended law lectures in Glasgow, Kentucky. Admitted to the bar in 1845. Attorney in Springfield, Kentucky. Member of the Whig Party. Elected county judge of Washington County in 1851 and re-elected in 1854. Elected as a member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1861. Lieutenant colonel of the 10th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) in 1861. Promoted to colonel in 1862 and served until 1865. Inspector-General of Kentucky from March to November 1865. Engaged in the oil speculation business in Cumberland River Valley.
